head.title: The Many Ways to Teach a Child

hedline.hl1: The Many Ways to Teach a Child

abstract.p: Jay Strader letter responds to Robert B Reich's July 11 Op-ed article that criticized education system and standardized testing; favors school voucher programs and charter schools (M)

block.p: Robert B. Reich's opinion of the current education system as a Procrustean bed (''One Education Does Not Fit All,'' Op-Ed, July 11) lacks something crucial: an alternative.

Though he speaks glowingly of the ''new options for how and what to learn,'' he does not mention what these new options might be. He speaks of jettisoning math and science classes, even though these are the subjects that best teach critical analysis and thinking skills.
Robert B. Reich's opinion of the current education system as a Procrustean bed (''One Education Does Not Fit All,'' Op-Ed, July 11) lacks something crucial: an alternative.

Though he speaks glowingly of the ''new options for how and what to learn,'' he does not mention what these new options might be. He speaks of jettisoning math and science classes, even though these are the subjects that best teach critical analysis and thinking skills.

Mr. Reich would do well to call publicly for rapid expansion of vouchers and of charter schools, which would tailor their curriculums to the ''kaleidoscope'' of new jobs better than any government decree.
